txt.en: 'And I think though Nature be cruel, Man surely is crueller.'
'Yet moreso Orc than Man, eh?'
'Well we are home now, aren't we?'
'How glad I shall be of a warm bed in Ost Rimmon.'
Scout ahead to the west
'Must we tarry long? We shall miss the battle!'
'Ugh. I must not move in that way.'
Accompany Malhar on the path out of the Mouths of Entwash.
This water is muddy and unsuitable for drinking
'I suppose Togbor shall always say his plan was best.'
'Oh, what an old man I am!'
'It is not far, now.'
'How glad I shall be of a warm bed in Ost Rimmon.'
Scouted to the south-west
'What was that?'
Return to Malhar
Return to Malhar
Go with Malhar
Bring the filled water-skin to Malhar, where he waits at a point in the Mouths of Entwash.
Hobbling Homeward

'There. I think I am ready to begin hobbling my way home. And see, [placeholder], I need not live to old age. I am already acquainted with aches and infirmity!\n\n'Luckily, I know these wetlands well and can find the path with ease. That is why we agreed to meet here, my brothers and I. When I need to rest we will stop. How is that?'
Malhar has stopped for a rest at a point in the Mouths of Entwash. Talk to him and see if you can be of any help.
DNT you've defended yourself
'If it is safe, then let us go.'
Malhar has asked you to scout ahead, south and west of the point where he has stopped in the Mouths of Entwash.
Variag defeated
Malhar has stopped on his path in the Mouths of Entwash. Talk to him to hear what he has to say.
'The weeds are thickest before the clear, eh?'
'Yes, this way.'

'Water,' Malhar croaks. 'I am parched. It is sapping my strength.'

He proffers you an empty water-skin.

'Fresh water should... uh!... not be far off... to the west.'
'There it is, [placeholder]. My home soil. I cannot say how this view warms my heart. We have done it. We are out of the marsh and the going will be easy. Let us meet back at Ost Rimmon.'
'I am soaked to my very bones, friend.'
'I think now I make the water wetter!'
'There it is, in sight!'
Talk to Malhar

'I have much to thank you for, [placeholder], although I have much to grieve for, it appears. It is a sorrowful day, indeed!

'I had understood, as all Gondor marches to war, that men of my blood might be taken from me. I never imagined, though, that cruel fate would take them so near to my door or that your kind hands would free some of them from its grip.

'But enough of such goings-on! As I began - you have my earnest thanks. You shall ever be known as friend here in the Beacon Hills, so long as I am keeper of it.'
'The Beacon Hills, my dear and longed-for home!'
The Beacon Hills comes into view
'Hm... What have I put my foot in, just now?'
'I indulge in pity on myself out here...'
Talk to Malhar
'Good? Then off we go. See if you can keep up, [placeholder]! Ha ha!'
Scout ahead to the south
Return to Glánhar
Scout ahead to the south-west
Talk to Malhar
You relay all that you encountered.\n\n'I see, then. No path is safe, I think, but I judge our best course is to head due south. Yes, I think so.'
Return to Malhar where he waits at a point in the Mouths of Entwash and describe what you saw scouting ahead.
'So I was right! I am glad you could handle them, friend. We are nearly out. Let us keep up our pace.'
Accompany Malhar on the path out of the Mouths of Entwash.

'Now I must gather my wits and decide which way to go. We have come far enough that there may be enemies near. I must also think on what paths will let us make our way without being seen.'

Malhar furrows his brow and thinks for a moment.

'No, I cannot decide this just by brooding here. I must ask you scout ahead and bring word of what you see. This area stretches south and west of here. Canvas its breadth and return to me.'
Return to Malhar where he waits at a point in the Mouths of Entwash and let him know that the path ahead is clear.
Accompany Malhar on the path out of the Mouths of Entwash.
'Water,' rasps Malhar. 'Please.'
'When first I slipped my bonds, oh what a thrill of freedom!'
'Scout the area south and west of here. Then return to me and tell of what you have seen.'
'Then safe amongst the reeds, I thought fortune had truly smiled on me.'
'I have regained much strength and can find my way. Meet me in Ost Rimmon, so my mother can give you a full and proper thanks.'
'But fortune may be fickle and freedom its own curse.'
'There you are, friend. See the family you have brought back together!'
'For soon the waterways I knew and loved turned upon me.'
'I could not say if Mother wished to slap my face or embrace me. I dare say she could manage to do both at once!'
'They spun me round, wrenched my foot with hidden roots.'
Malhar stopped again, just as the Beacon Hills came into full view. Talk to him to hear what he has to say.
'You found Malhar and you brought him home. No words of thanks could do justice to my gratitude for that.'
'They buzzed and stung and leeched me.'
'It is one thing to go marshing on a summer's day...'
'I am but half-forgiven, it seems. But with her sons returned, she has other ears to cuff than mine in her daily rounds. And that, I well believe, is the best I could hope for!'
'Entirely another to make a home here!'
'Then I think on the deaths my father and eldest brother chose.'
Defend yourself
Malhar is ready to travel back to Ost Rimmon.
You have led Malhar safely out of the Mouths of Entwash. Go with him to Glánhar in the centre of Ost Rimmon.

Malhar takes the water-skin in both hands and drinks greedily.

'There, that is better. How is it, [placeholder], of all the things I asked you to fetch for me before setting off, water was not one?

'Well, we have set that right. Now let us be on our way.'
Talk to Malhar when you are ready to begin the journey out of the Mouths of Entwash.
'Mother, you must let the poor shepherd be.'
'I would swear that I heard something. Please look ahead and see if I'm correct. Use caution!'
'Did you hear that? I would swear that I heard something. Humour me and check ahead. Be wary!'
Malhar has stopped and seems to be listening hard for some sound
Armed men jump out at you
Scouted to the west
Scouted to the south-west
Scouted to the south
Investigate the noises Malhar thinks he heard, just south of the point he stopped in the Mouths of Entwash.
Go with Malhar
The noises Malhar heard ahead of him in the Mouths of Entwash turned out to be a Variag ambush!
'Malhar, my brother, how glad I am to see you!'
Investigate the sounds
'No, I fear we cannot linger here.'
Filled the water-skin
This water looks fresh and clear
Malhar comes to a halt and looks around, hesitating
DNT son 3 starts coughing, and comes to a stop
Fill the water-skin
Find water
Give Malhar the water-skin
Go with Malhar
Talk to Malhar
Accompany Malhar on the path out of the Mouths of Entwash.
Malhar has stopped for a rest at a point in the Mouths of Entwash. Talk to him and see if you can be of any help.
Malhar is stopped short by a dry coughing fit
Go with Malhar
Talk to Malhar
Scout ahead to the south-west
Find fresh water near Malhar, at a point in the Mouths of Entwash, and fill his empty water-skin.
'How the Variag dogs cut them down.'
